title: Andy Murray defeats Marius Copil to move to European Tour semi finals
text:
Andy Murray is just two wins away from what would be a remarkable title victory at the European Open after battling through a wildly undulating quarter final.

The 32 year-old Scot will play his first semi-final since the 2017 French Open after overcoming Romania's Marius Copil 6-3 6-7 6-4 in two hours and 35 minutes.

He was left awaiting the winner of Friday's match between rising Frenchman Ugo Humbert and the fifth seed, world No 20 Guido Pella from Argentina.

Andy Murray defeated Marius Copil 6-3 6-7 6-4 in two hours and 35 minutes in Antwerp

The last time Murray played Copil was in Washington, in August 2018, when he was struggling to come back from his first hip surgery. The match ended in the early hours with the Scot in tears after a marathon victory.

This time Murray broke straightaway, and although he was broken back for 2-2 he quickly repeated it, standing in aggressively to receive and attacking his opponent's second serve.

He was cruising to victory at 5-3 in the second before playing his worst game of the match to be pulled back, and then had a match point at 7-6 in the tiebreak against an opponent who had suddenly become inspired.

Murray, for whom the Antwerp event is his fourth straight tournament, showed the greater experience in the end by breaking at 4-4, serving it out at the second attempt.

Murray will now meet 21-year-old Frenchman Ugo Humbert, ranked 70, who upset fifth seed Guido Pella in three sets.
